comments:
I installed the latest stable build (20020125) on a PC. Now I regularly get 
messages saying:
    See error log for more details.
The most serious one of these is when I try to display Help contents. It
says:
An internal error has occurred. Plugin org.eclipse.help.ui.activation failed
while loading class org.eclipse.help.internal.ui.HelpContentsAction. See
error log for more details.

First of all, I would like to see in the message, where the error log could be 
found.
With help of Adom Kiezun I found it, the contents are below.
I would really like to be able to see the help!

What JDK are you using? The included log file seems to imply that you're using 
jdk1.2.
If that's the case, you will need to upgrade to 1.3 or newer.

>>What JDK are you using? The included log file seems to imply that you're using
jdk1.2. 
>>If that's the case, you will need to upgrade to 1.3 or newer.
I have both JDK1.2 and JDK1.3 installed. I told Eclipse to use 1.3, do I need 
to do something else?

OK. I did an experiment, and found that  specifying 
     eclipse -vm d:/jdk1.3_02/bin/java.exe 
does the trick.
I think that Eclpise could be more polite and tell me during startup that it 
could not find the right vm and tell me also what to do!

And, the documentation on the startup parameters is not very clear. At first I 
tried: -vm d:\jdk1.3.1_02\bin and got a message saying "No such file or 
directory". That is very un-informative, because I have such a directory. Only 
after I added \java.exe to this it worked.

As a result of this bug, I hope that you will check for the right java version 
at start-up, and give an informative message if Eclipse finds <1.3 first.
In addition, the description of how to use the -vm parameter should be more 
clear, and finally, the message if you specify the -vm parameter not correctly 
should actually say what it expects! This is three things to fix. 
While you are at it, maybe the usage of the JRE preference could be clarified a 
bit better, for example that Eclipse itself does not use this preference!
Thanks for your attention and feedback, regards, Ghica.

Routing to core for verifying valid level of vm, better help/error messages for 
vm startup option.
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 9154 ***
